channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: What an Upended Mideast Means for Trump and U.S. Gulf Allies
item.description: While major ruptures are not expected, Gulf states are urging a tougher stance on Israel and a softening toward Iran, positions that differ greatly fr...

item.title: A New Age of American Interference in Europe
item.description: Elon Musk and MAGA are already disrupting the status quo, and Europe seems ill-prepared.

item.title: L.A.’s Private Firefighters, and U.S. Childhood Vaccination Rates Fall
item.description: Plus, remembering a civil rights Freedom Rider.

item.title: Troops Detained in Ukraine Give Rare Glimpse Into North Korea’s Military
item.description: Ukraine’s president released a video of the two soldiers being interrogated, revealing they knew little about the war they were sent to fight in.

item.title: ‘Den of Thieves’ sequel tops box office as Robbie Williams movie ‘Better Man’ flops
item.description: Mid-January is often a slow moviegoing period, and that was slightly exacerbated by the closures of about 10 theaters in Los Angeles, the country’s to...

item.title: Biden administration announces more AI chip export restrictions to ensure China doesn’t get access through third countries
item.description: The new rules update controls on chips, requiring authorizations for exports, re-exports and in-country transfers—while also including a series of exc...

item.title: How Lagging Vaccination Could Lead to a Polio Resurgence
item.description: In its original form, the virus survives in just two countries. But a type linked to an oral vaccine used in other nations has already turned up in th...

item.title: Biden Administration Adopts Rules to Guide A.I.’s Global Spread

item.title: Why CEO headhunters have this 34-year-old tech executive on their radar
item.description: CEO recruiters are eyeing the millennial operations chief at OpenAI.

item.title: OpenAI Courts Trump With Vision for ‘A.I. in America’
item.description: The maker of ChatGPT hopes to spur investment from the Middle East and avoid strict regulations on the development of new technologies.

item.description: Ukraine’s president released a video of the two soldiers being interrogated, revealing they knew little about the war they were sent to fight in.

item.title: Dutch chipmaking giant ASML’s key feeder university, located just 5 miles away, suspends lessons after cyber attack
item.description: Eindhoven University of Technology said its network collapse had "all the hallmarks of a cyber attack."
